DOC.brief_title: Pilot Behavioral Support Intervention After Bariatric Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Bariatric surgery patient may experience significant psychosocial change surgery , little psychological support available beyond support group postoperatively . Psychosocial change surgery , include mood fluctuation , interpersonal issue substance use , potential low quality life interfere adherence postoperative diet lifestyle , diminish weight loss outcome . This prospective randomized pilot trial evaluate effect postoperative support program targeting quality life , psychosocial function adherence behavior change Geisinger Health System ( GHS ) bariatric surgery patient . In study two arm . The intervention arm include forty bariatric surgery patient ( procedure type ) GHS Center Nutrition Weight Management ( CNWM ) participate four month bi-weekly postoperative behavioral support program address psychosocial change surgery , strategy postoperative diet adherence prevent weight regain . The control arm include 40 usual care ( UC ) patient center complete bariatric surgery within one year . Both group complete two set survey . The first set administer study initiation . The second set administer upon completion 8 session intervention group . The control group also complete survey timeframe ( approximately 4-6 month baseline survey completion ) . Upon study completion , control group member afford opportunity participate postoperative behavioral support program offer intervention group . The primary endpoint study quality life secondary endpoint include difference psychosocial functioning ( mood , eat behavior ) adherence ( diet , physical activity , appointment ) well patient satisfaction , treatment feasibility attrition .
